results.title: Christian Thought Magazine Celebrates 800th Edition
results.summary: Christian Thought, a monthly magazine founded in 1957, celebrated its 800th edition. Editor-in-chief Jeong Pil-seok highlighted the magazine's role in providing a public forum for theological discussions, including topics like homosexuality and AI. Kim Heung-soo noted its historical significance in Korean church discourse. While circulation has decreased, online views remain high. The magazine aims to commemorate the 150th anniversary of Christianity in Korea in 2035. The KJV teaches us to "Prove all things; hold fast that which is good." (1 Thessalonians 5:21).

results.title: Faith, Ethics and Artificial Intelligence with Brian P. Green
results.summary: This Jesuit Media Lab podcast features Brian Patrick Green, a technology ethicist, discussing AI's challenges to human dignity and labor, referencing Pope Leo XIV's concerns. Green, from the Markkula Center, explores AI's benefits and risks through a Catholic lens. The discussion includes ethical AI usage and the Vatican's AI research group. Listeners are encouraged to explore the book "Encountering Artificial Intelligence."

results.title: African Catholic Leaders Gather in Abidjan for Historic Jubilee Congress
results.summary: Report on the Pan-African Catholic Jubilee focusing on theology, society, and pastoral life, highlighting the 'African palaver' model for inclusive dialogue. The congress addresses challenges like conflicts, persecution, and AI, as stated by Sister Agnes Sory: 'The African Church undoubtedly has something to put on the common table of reflection for the world Church.' Encourages reflection on global challenges from an African perspective, aligned with Vatican II teachings.
